 019:                        np_floats max_dist, bint return_tree, int rng):
 020:     """Segments image using quickshift clustering in Color-(x,y) space.
 021: 
 022:     Produces an oversegmentation of the image using the quickshift mode-seeking
 023:     algorithm.
 024: 
 025:     Parameters
 026:     ----------
 027:     image : (M, N, C) ndarray
 028:         Input image.
 029:     kernel_size : float
 030:         Width of Gaussian kernel used in smoothing the
 031:         sample density. Higher means fewer clusters.
 032:     max_dist : float
 033:         Cut-off point for data distances.
 034:         Higher means fewer clusters.
 035:     return_tree : bool
 036:         Whether to return the full segmentation hierarchy tree and distances.
 037:     rng : {`numpy.random.Generator`, int}, optional
 038:         Pseudo-random number generator.
 039:         By default, a PCG64 generator is used (see :func:`numpy.random.default_rng`).
 040:         If `rng` is an int, it is used to seed the generator.
 041: 
 042:         PRNG used to break ties.
 043: 
 044:     Returns
 045:     -------
 046:     segment_mask : (M, N) ndarray
 047:         Integer mask indicating segment labels.
